intro: Minuartia ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's sand-flower, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh conditions. It typically thrives in sandy soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
